#Text=Penmaenpool
#Text=Penmaenpool ( Welsh : Pwll Penmaen ) is a village in the Welsh county of Gwynedd and is also in the Snowdonia National Park .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By car :
#Text=Penmaenpool is on the A493 Tywyn / Dolgellau trunk road .
#Text=The village is about three miles west of Dolgellau and 12 miles north-east of Tywyn .
#Text=A bus service runs to and from nearby Dolgellau .
#Text=There are two bus stops in Penmaenpool .
#Text=By train : Take the Cambrian Coast Line to Morfa Mawddach .
#Text=Morfa Mawddach is about three miles west of Penmaenpool .
#Text=( There is no railway line to Penmaenpool . )
#Text=By boat : Small vessels can sail down the estuary to Penmaenpool from Barmouth .
#Text=Contact the Barmouth Harbour Master on 01341 280671 for information .
#Text=See
#Text=Wooden Toll Bridge .
#Text=A famous landmark at Penmaenpool is the wooden toll bridge that spans the Mawddach Estuary .
#Text=Replacing the ferry , the wooden bridge was built in 1879 by the Penmaenpool Bridge Company under the auspices of John Leigh Taylor of nearby Penmaenuchaf Hall .
#Text=The toll bridge is a Cadw-registered building .
#Text=Cadw is the official guardian of the built heritage of Wales .
#Text=Do
#Text=Old Railway Footpath .
#Text=Walkers and cyclists can travel along the old Cambrian Railway line which is now a public path following the course of the Mawddach Estuary .
#Text=The shale path extends from the outskirts of Dolgellau via Penmaenpool to Arthog .
#Text=Mawddach Way .
#Text=Penmaenpool is also a start/end point for one of the suggested three section of the 49 km long distance footpath walk ' The Mawddach Way ' which is a circular walk around the Mawddach Estuary .
#Text=RSPB Information Centre ( the old signal box ) .
#Text=Birdwatchers should visit the RSPB observation centre which is housed in near the toll bridge .
#Text=The signal box affords ornithologists good views of the Mawddach Estuary and tidal mudflats .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The George III Hotel ( is located at the end of the toll bridge ) , ☏ +441341422525 .
#Text=open throughout the year .
#Text=Hotels
#Text=Penmaenuchaf Hall Hotel , ☏ +441341422129 .
#Text=Penmaen Farm Self Catering Cottages , ☏ +441341423937 .
#Text=Coed Cae Bed & Breakfast , Taicynhaeaf , ☏ +441341430628 .
#Text=Located just a short stroll across the Penmaenpool Bridge
#Text=Hostels
#Text=YHA Kings , ☏ +448707705900 .
#Text=42 beds across 7 rooms .
#Text=Out of season , it 's possible for groups to reserve the entire hostel .
